1. 1)	What are key requirements of loT connected devices?

Correct - Answer:  D  There are technical specifications not listed here, but if a device, or a component of a machine (e.g., the drill of an oil rig) has an on/off switch and can be operated over Wi-Fi via built-in sensors, it is a Thing connected over the Internet. In other words, an Internet of Things connected device.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  D  There are technical specifications not listed here, but if a device, or a component of a machine (e.g., the drill of an oil rig) has an on/off switch and can be operated over Wi-Fi via built-in sensors, it is a Thing connected over the Internet. In other words, an Internet of Things connected device.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.text: 1. 1)	What are key requirements of loT connected devices?

ContentStructure.title: 2.  2)	Experts predict that there will be ___ billion ‘things’ in circulation by 2020.

Correct - Answer:  B  Gartner puts the estimated number at “over 26 billion”, but some estimators have put the number at over 100 billion. This includes coffee makers, washing machines and other appliances that don’t need an internet connection to do their original task, as well as things built for industrial use.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  Gartner puts the estimated number at “over 26 billion”, but some estimators have put the number at over 100 billion. This includes coffee makers, washing machines and other appliances that don’t need an internet connection to do their original task, as well as things built for industrial use.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.text: 2.  2)	Experts predict that there will be ___ billion ‘things’ in circulation by 2020.

ContentStructure.title: 3.  How old was the first IoT hardware?

Correct - Answer:  B  The concept of an IoT was discussed as early as 1982. The first internet connected appliance was a modified Coke machine at Carnegie Mellon University. The coke machine was able to report its inventory and whether newly loaded drinks were cold.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  The concept of an IoT was discussed as early as 1982. The first internet connected appliance was a modified Coke machine at Carnegie Mellon University. The coke machine was able to report its inventory and whether newly loaded drinks were cold.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 3.  How old was the first IoT hardware?

ContentStructure.title: 4.  What is the best way to protect your loT network
Keep secure data on a separate network

answer.title: Keep secure data on a separate network

ContentStructure.title: Limit yourself to only use smart devices you “really” need

answer.title: Limit yourself to only use smart devices you “really” need

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  D  Each additional device we add to our network is another gateway for hackers or threats to access our information. One of the best ways to protect against threats to limit the amount of devises that you have on your network, before connecting first ask “do I really require the device to be smart?”. If you must have many appliances on your network then create two different networks. One that contains important sensitive information and another that contains all other appliances.  Finally make sure that you change your default settings on your smart appliances. Give them passwords that are difficult to guess. This will insure that your network does not get compromised.   Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  D  Each additional device we add to our network is another gateway for hackers or threats to access our information. One of the best ways to protect against threats to limit the amount of devises that you have on your network, before connecting first ask “do I really require the device to be smart?”. If you must have many appliances on your network then create two different networks. One that contains important sensitive information and another that contains all other appliances.  Finally make sure that you change your default settings on your smart appliances. Give them passwords that are difficult to guess. This will insure that your network does not get compromised.   Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 4.  What is the best way to protect your loT network

ContentStructure.title: 5. In 2016 the Mirai botnet caused a massive distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack that disrupted major internet websites including Twitter, Spotify and PayPal. Which loT devices were exploited?

Correct - Answer:  A  A botnet infects devices with malware that forces them to report to a central command and control centre, and work together to flood targeted sites. The millions of webcams used in Mirai were lacking security protections (such as firewalls) and were later recalled by the manufacturer. The webcam owners were unaware this took place.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  A botnet infects devices with malware that forces them to report to a central command and control centre, and work together to flood targeted sites. The millions of webcams used in Mirai were lacking security protections (such as firewalls) and were later recalled by the manufacturer. The webcam owners were unaware this took place.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 5. In 2016 the Mirai botnet caused a massive distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack that disrupted major internet websites including Twitter, Spotify and PayPal. Which loT devices were exploited?

ContentStructure.title: 6.  Security expert Eugene Kaspersky calls the IoT what?

Correct - Answer: A  “I am afraid that in the very near future we will see very bad incidents, maybe global incidents, from attacks which are designed for Mac or for Android systems,” he said, “and maybe in the future there are iPhones, iPads, then smart TVs, then maybe smartwatches, then smart cars, smart coffee machines, vacuum cleaners, smart houses, etc etc... You call it Internet of Things – I call it Internet of Threats.”  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer: A  “I am afraid that in the very near future we will see very bad incidents, maybe global incidents, from attacks which are designed for Mac or for Android systems,” he said, “and maybe in the future there are iPhones, iPads, then smart TVs, then maybe smartwatches, then smart cars, smart coffee machines, vacuum cleaners, smart houses, etc etc... You call it Internet of Things – I call it Internet of Threats.”  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 6.  Security expert Eugene Kaspersky calls the IoT what?

ContentStructure.title: 7. What question do you need to ask when installing a IoT device
Does this thing really need to connect to the internet?

answer.title: Does this thing really need to connect to the internet?

ContentStructure.title: What data is this thing actually collecting?

answer.title: What data is this thing actually collecting?

ContentStructure.title: How is my data stored and used?

answer.title: How is my data stored and used?

ContentStructure.title: What happens if the manufacturer goes out of business?

answer.title: What happens if the manufacturer goes out of business?

ContentStructure.title: Has the manufacturer been breached before and if so, how did they respond?

answer.title: Has the manufacturer been breached before and if so, how did they respond?

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:   F  When installing a new IoT device we must first ask ourselves if we really require this device to be connected. As we increase the amount of devices we increase the amount of gateways into our information. If you must connect the device to your network then first do backgrounds check on the manufacturer and the device settings. Use abackground check to confirm that the manufacturer is safe and reputable and is not using your information for something that you did not agree too. Finally, confirm that the manufacturer has a strong information security history and that they have not fallen victim to past breaches.  If you follow these steps you will have a much higher probability of safety with your new IoT device.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:   F  When installing a new IoT device we must first ask ourselves if we really require this device to be connected. As we increase the amount of devices we increase the amount of gateways into our information. If you must connect the device to your network then first do backgrounds check on the manufacturer and the device settings. Use a background check to confirm that the manufacturer is safe and reputable and is not using your information for something that you did not agree too. Finally, confirm that the manufacturer has a strong information security history and that they have not fallen victim to past breaches.  If you follow these steps you will have a much higher probability of safety with your new IoT device.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 7. What question do you need to ask when installing a IoT device

ContentStructure.title: 8.  Could a medical device, such as a pacemaker or spinal cord stimulator, intended to help patients, be deliberately hacked?

Correct - Answer:  A  A new survey by the Ponemon Institute found that 67 percent of medical device manufacturers and 56 percent of healthcare delivery organizations believe an attack on their devices is likely to happen within the next 12 months.  80% of them believe this is partly because medical devices are very difficult to secure.  There is also a lack of regulations on the security of these devices.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  A new survey by the Ponemon Institute found that 67 percent of medical device manufacturers and 56 percent of healthcare delivery organizations believe an attack on their devices is likely to happen within the next 12 months.  80% of them believe this is partly because medical devices are very difficult to secure.  There is also a lack of regulations on the security of these devices.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.
